pattern.author: musbah
pattern.name: eMI
pattern.htmlLongDescription:
eMI – Evaluating Multiple Interpretations

Learning challenge: This design is suitable for a situation where you want learners to have access to different perspectives on a common theme, in order to foster critical thinking and deeper understanding. This is a core challenge in many humanities and arts subjects.

Key features: At the core of the learning experience is a specially designed task that allows learners to interrogate multiple commentators on the same artefact or situation. The learner can chose a topic and ‘ask’ a commentator on his/her views. The learner can then compare and contrast the views of the different commentators. The steps that precede this central screen prepare the learners for the task. The succeeding screens use questions and feedback to encourage the learner to think critically, and reflect on what they have learned.

First use: This design was developed in conjunction with the UK National Subject Centre for History, Classics and Archaeology to introduce learners to different perspectives on how to interpret an artefact from Ancient Greece. It has been used subsequently with a wide range of topics.

Further information see: The eMI Pattern

func.title: What Topic
func.description: Introduce the topic – briefly orient the learner to what is to come.

guidance.page: Provide a title and introductory paragraph introducing the theme of appreciating different interpretations of a common topic.

func.title: Why Learn
func.description: This learning experience concerns appreciating multiple perspectives – and hence a view on the nature of ‘knowledge’ that this evokes.

guidance.page: Explicitly introduce that this learning experience concerns a central intellectual skill – appreciating multiple perspectives – that student needs to grasp to fully appreciate the subject domain.

func.title: Preview Outcome
func.description: Preview the learning outcomes for the learning task.

guidance.page: Preview the outcomes form the learning task – set out explicitly these intended outcomes.

func.title: Do Preparatory Task
func.description: Do a preparatory task, before tackling the main task.

guidance.page: Set a task that will initially engage the learner with the task of appreciating multiple perspectives. The feedback on the task should prepare the learner to tackle the main task more effectively.

func.title: Feedback on Preparatory Task
func.description: Receive feedback on the preparatory task that provides orientation for tackling the main task.

guidance.page: Receive feedback on the task that enables the learner to appreciate key aspects of the intended learning experience.

func.title: Main Task
func.description: Set task to access different views and reflect on the lessons learned.

guidance.page: Set out in words the task for the learner. This is normally followed by a screen dealing with accessing multiple interpretations.

func.title: Access Views
func.description: Access the views of different commentators on a common theme.

guidance.page: Use the special 'Access Views' screen layout to load a picture (or text) to indicate the topic of discussion. Enter the issues to be discussed. Then add pictures and appropriate text and/or audio files for each commentator on these issues.

func.title: Multiple Choice
func.description: Answer questions with feedback designed to improve sensitivity to interpretation.

guidance.page: The key part is to provide feedback that provokes reflection rather than just confirming a correct/incorrect answer.

func.title: Reflect
func.description: Reflect on what you have learner about evaluating the views of others.

guidance.page: Provide a simple text message urging the learner to explore more widely the significance of appreciating multiple perspectives and its implications for the nature of knowledge.
You can use this node for any purpose you want. Add some text to define what the function is doing.
